Raw Material Extraction.description: Extraction of raw materials such as aluminum and glass used in the construction of the Google Pixel 8 Pro.
Raw Material Extraction.rationale: Essential for the manufacturing of the phone's components; involves mining operations and raw material processing.

Production of Intermediate Materials.description: Manufacturing of components such as the Tensor G3 processor and OLED screen.
Production of Intermediate Materials.rationale: Intermediate component production is key to assembling the final product.

Recycled Material Processing.description: Processing and incorporating recycled materials into the phone's design.
Recycled Material Processing.rationale: Aligns with Google’s sustainability practices by reducing raw material usage.

Transport of Raw Materials.description: Logistics for transporting raw materials to the manufacturing facility.
Transport of Raw Materials.rationale: Critical for supplying manufacturing plants with necessary materials.

Manufacturing and Assembly.description: Processes involved in assembling the Google Pixel 8 Pro, including component integration.
Manufacturing and Assembly.rationale: Core stage where all components are assembled into the final product.

Quality Control.description: Inspection processes to ensure the final quality of the Google Pixel 8 Pro.
Quality Control.rationale: Vital for maintaining product quality and ensuring customer satisfaction.

Distribution Logistics.description: Transportation of the finished product to distributors and retailers.
Distribution Logistics.rationale: Essential to bring the product to market and reach consumers.

Storage.description: Storage of devices in warehouses before they reach retailers.
Storage.rationale: A necessary stage in ensuring product availability and supply chain management.

Retail Setup.description: Store and display setup processes to prepare for product sales.
Retail Setup.rationale: Ensures that the product is effectively displayed for consumer purchasing.

Device Operation.description: Use of the Google Pixel 8 Pro by consumers, including software and applications.
Device Operation.rationale: Primary function of the product, involving consumer interaction with its features.

Software Updates.description: Regular updates provided to the device to ensure functionality and security.
Software Updates.rationale: Important for maintaining device performance and security over its lifecycle.

Device Repair.description: Procedures for repairing damaged components of the Google Pixel 8 Pro.
Device Repair.rationale: Necessary to extend the lifespan of the product and provide ongoing functionality.

Component Replacement.description: Replacing components such as batteries or screens if they fail.
Component Replacement.rationale: Critical to ensure device longevity and customer satisfaction.

N/A.rationale: Refurbishment is not a standard practice outlined explicitly for Pixel devices as part of their regular usage phase.

Energy Consumption.description: Electricity used by the Google Pixel 8 Pro during typical operation.
Energy Consumption.rationale: Quantifying energy use is essential in understanding the device's impact during use.

Water Impact.description: Use of water associated with the operation of the phone (e.g., in manufacturing).
Water Impact.rationale: No significant water use during the operational phase except indirect factors in data centers.

Device Decommissioning.description: Safely deactivating the device for disposal or recycling.
Device Decommissioning.rationale: Initiates the end-of-life stage and prepares the device for recycling.

Waste Transport.description: Logistics for moving phones to recycling centers and waste management facilities.
Waste Transport.rationale: Integral to ensuring proper recycling and disposal of e-waste.

Recycling Processes.description: Breaking down devices into reusable components or materials.
Recycling Processes.rationale: Crucial for recovering materials and minimizing environmental impacts.

Disposal.description: Final disposal of non-recyclable components in landfills or waste facilities.
Disposal.rationale: Necessary for handling components that cannot be recycled further.
